notes: Lopes da Silva contemporary dance classes integrate elements from various movement practices including floor work, release technique, and improvisation. We will start class with a gentle warm up, progressing into improvisation to activate the senses, and learn short dance phrases that will be combined into a fun choreography at the end of class. This class is designed for the intermediate level dancer who wants to learn new skills, connect to their bodies and access joy with oneself and others through dance.

notes:
Named San Francisco's Best Dance Workout by San Francisco Magazine (2015, 2016, & 2018) and Favorite and Unique Workout by 7x7 Magazine (2020).


Rhythm & Motion dance workout classes are open to all students of all levels and abilities. Taught by experienced dancers and performing artists, the class features a broad range of movement styles with choreography inspired by popular music from around the globe. Balancing the challenge of learning choreography and movement techniques with the dance-floor euphoria of a good party, the (mostly) follow-along class format starts with a well-balanced warm-up and leads to high energy stamina and strength building choreography. The experience is low-pressure, joyful, full-bodied and sweaty. Everyone is welcome!
Our Modern format is rooted in contemporary and modern dance vocabulary. Students build core strength and technique through floor and barre-inspired choreography, and then move to standing choreography for technical skill and lyrical, full-body movement for stamina and strength.
Suggested attire: Comfortable clothing that you can easily move in (e.g. tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, yoga pants). This class is generally done in bare feet or socks.
For more information, visit rhythmandmotion.com

Students will enjoy a complete and enriching personal and collective dance experience.

notes:
This Pilates Mat class is designed to stretch, strengthen, and control the movement through your âpowerhouseâ, core muscles. The classical mat order progresses clients from the beginning to the intermediate series. Stretching is added to a flow of exercises and increases flexibility with the connection of the powerhouse. The goal is to correct your alignment, keep you balanced and stable, give better posture and exercise form by staying true to Joseph Pilatesâ original intentions of moving with breath, rhythm, and flow.

It is suitable for all levels and ages. Depending on your level of comfort, you may need small props like a cushion, straps, or towel. If you have previous injuries or discomfort, please let your teacher know for modifications.

notes:
TropiCali Dancehall (All Levels)
Dancehall is a style of dance from the parties of Jamaica. In this class you will learn body basics, technique, and the signature codified steps used in Dancehall. Also In this class you will learn about the history of the dance, its current evolution, the culture around dancehall dancing, and the people behind the dance.
Aimee Rose is a native San Franciscan who has a deep passion for dance. Her focus on Dancehall began in 2013 and since then she has opened shows for well known dancehall and reggae artist, choreographed or attributed choreography for numerous music videos, hosted workshops with top Jamaican and international Dancehall Dancers, traveled extensively teaching as well as bringing her students on bi-annual trips to Jamaica, in addition teaches multiple weekly classes in the San Francisco Bay Area for you to join the fun!
For more information please visit www.tropicalidancehall.com / IG: @tropicalitrapsetta , @tropicalidancehall , @Bay2Ja_Dancehallcamp / FB: TropiCali Dancehall / YouTube: Aimee Rose
19290b7eb0.title: African Diaspora - TropiCali Dancehall (All Levels) (IN PERSON) - Mixed

notes:
LudoSport teaches students to safely utilize light sabers in sporting competitions by learning techniques from seven forms of combat. With practice, students are able to carefully duel with one another, participate in official LudoSport tournaments, and over time, may even qualify to compete in National and World Championship events.
LudoSport was founded in 2006 by 3 friends in Italy who had a vision for creating a combat sport that utilized the iconic light saber as a weapon. By combining their knowledge of various martial arts and sword arts, they developed a rich set of techniques that are now part of the ever evolving learning system for the sport. A number of schools have opened up in Europe since the inception of the sport and have amassed approximately 5000 LudoSport athletes around the world.
The first US academy launched in San Francisco in 2016 and has seen many students come through its doors since its opening. We are excited to have partnered with ODC to welcome you into a new world of learning, friendship, and fun whenever you're ready to visit and take a class!
Discovery classes are designed to give participants an overview of what LudoSport sporting light saber combat is all about. You'll be introduced to the fundamentals: the basic stances, movement, offensive and defensive techniques. At the end of the class you will have the opportunity to practice the techniques you learned in a sparring match. No experience necessary. For ages 16+

Please Wear/Bring:
Comfortable sportswear
Non-marking/Non-black soled footwear
A bottle of water
We'll Provide the Sabers! The Italian Designed Sport Saber LamaDiLuce Polaris SSe-1 will be available for your use during the class. Be ready for some fun!
224802bc6e.teacher: . James Billings, Michael Masangkay, & Darien Caine
224802bc6e.title: Health - LudoSport - Lightsaber Sparring - Discovery Class - Beginning

notes: Build strength, stamina, control, agility, and flexibility. This class consists of a selection of dynamic and static exercises designed to improve endurance, strength and mobility to improve dancer turns, leaps, extensions, lifts, and performance, and help prevent injury. Strength training uses resistance such as weights and body weight to target specific muscles or muscle groups and work at a challenging intensity to achieve strength gains. Conditioning through aerobic and anaerobic training works to improve cardiovascular function. Class formats and exercises will vary each week. This class is beneficial for dancers and movers of all levels.

notes:
Essentrics is a dynamic and effective full body workout which simultaneously strengthens and stretches every muscle in the body resulting in greater joint mobility, improved posture and increased flexibility. Based on the theories of Miranda Esmonde-White this program draws on the methods of ballet and the healing principles of physiotherapy. Essentrics uses a broad spectrum of techniques and exercises to accomplish its many objectives by using smooth and restorative movements.

Please bring a mat or towel and dress comfortably.

notes:
2-Day Ground Grooves Workshop
Saturday, July 22 2:30-6:30pm
Sunday, July 23 11:30am-3:30pm
Price: $100


Ground GroovesÂ is a floorwork class emphasizing continuous and fluid movement from a methodical and safe approach. Designed for dancers who are new to floorwork but have some movement experience, this workshop emphasizes building tools and coordination to safely execute fundamental movements. Concepts and choreography are taught at a slower pace.
Working with and without momentum, dancers move through a variety of rolls, slides, inversions, and shoulder rolls focusing on efficiency for longevity, absorbing impact with muscular resistance, and developing qualitative movement textures.
Dancers can expect to gain:
-a deeper physical expression of floorwork texture, dynamics, and flow
-increased awareness of weight placement and its effect on spinal freedom and transitional clarity
-tools for developing a lush, spongy movement quality
-control and fluidity moving in and out of the floor
Dancers can expect to experience:
-a relaxed environment where everyone can experience movement with joy and curiosity
-ample personalized guidance
-connection with other dancers in a non-judgmental learning space
-a concentrated focus on movement concepts to improve efficiency and prevent injury
-low-impact alternatives that build towards more challenging movements
-guided written self-reflection
Please note: Enrollment for both days is required. No options for drop-in.
5f7d0e33c3.title: Contemporary/Release Workshop - Ground Grooves - Mixed

notes: This classical Pilates Mat class is designed for true beginners new to Pilates, as well as advanced students who wish to deepen their âpowerhouse,â or core center, with a strong review of Pilates' fundamental principles. The focus will be on establishing the connection between the powerhouse and the rest of the body while staying true to Joseph Pilatesâ original intentions of moving with breath, rhythm, and flow. This classical sequence of exercises progresses clients from the beginning to intermediate series. Three goals of stretch, strength, and control are incorporated to intensify the powerhouse connection, challenging everybody at every level. Hands on corrections are fundamental part of classical pilates and will greatly inform your learning, however, please tell your teacher beforehand if you do not wish to be touched.

These classes introduce the technique, culture, and spirituality of Haitian dance. You will learn the subtle movements of the Rada dances, the strength of the Nago dances, and the excitement of the Petro Dances, as well as the joy and abandon of Carnival and Banda dances. Accompanied by a group of traditional drummers. All levels welcome!
Folkloric dance skirts are welcome, but not required. Class is danced barefoot.

notes: This class is an Alvin Alley influenced style, with a fusion of Horton, Graham, Limon, Afro, Gospel, Blues, and Ballet. The class will focus on technique, musicality, strength and style. We will also focus on expression (emotional and spiritual). We will work on choreography that builds from week to week, 3-5 minutes pieces, using contemporary music. The first three warm-ups are set and they provide movements that work on the style and technique. The adagio and across the floor change often. The class will be a challenge, but also of fun and fulfillment of your physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being. Elvia believes in a supportive, friendly, loving, and positive atmosphere for class. Welcome!!
a7acc89113.title: Jazz - Modern Jazz Blues - Open Class (IN PERSON) - Intermediate

notes: This contemporary movement class is for dancers familiar with contemporary and release dance forms that want to dig deeper into their own physicality and artistry. Kristinâs guided approach to contemporary movement is focused on finding alignment of the body, then moving with ease and dynamic energy. Classes will begin with a meditative body scan and improvisation exercises. You will explore articulation of the spine, pelvis, and torso all while finding momentum through the body. Large energetic phrase work will have a constant play with gravity; going in and out of the floor, upside down and traveling though the space with fierce abandonment. Kristin believes that contemporary movement is for all bodies and welcomes all into a strong community where we can learn, sweat, and dance together!
a9103139cf.title: Contemporary/Release - Contemporary - Intermediate (IN PERSON) - Int/Adv

notes:
Vogue is characterized by model-like poses, inspired by Vogue Magazine, integrated with angular, linear and rigid arm, leg and body movements. The style of dance arose from Harlem ballrooms in the early 1930s. This dance style was originally called "performance" and evolved into the more intricate and illusory form that is now called "vogue-ing".
There are six elements of Vogue-ing: hands, spins, catwalk, duck walk, dips and floor performance. The class will start with a fifteen-minute warm-up where we focus on core work and isolations. After the warm-up, we will transition into across the floor work. Not only will you learn the history of Vogue, but you will receive an intense workout.
Jocquese will break down each element from hands to spins, catwalk to duck walk, dips to floor performance. Each element has specific movements that will strengthen and engage different parts of the body.
a9182df09a.title: Hip Hop - Vogue & Tone (IN PERSON) - Mixed

notes:
Immerse yourself in an eclectic mix of traditional and contemporary Latin dance that reflects the beautiful complexity of our diverse Latin music of today! Learn a variety of Latin Dance genres including Afro-Brazilian Samba, Afro-Cuban, Salsa, Rumba, Son, Mambo, Cha cha, Merengue, Reggaeton and Latin Jazz and experience how traditional rhythms and lyrics show up in our contemporary popular music!
Â
Classes begin with a full-body warm-up, continue with short center floor combinations and then develop into rhythmic dance sequences drawing from a variety of Latin dance styles. The Wednesday night Fundamentals class features more repetition and practice with traveling across the floor. All students are welcome to this multi-level, Spanish bi-lingual class. Join us and experience the healing power of dance all in a fun, energetic and supportive atmosphere!
Suggested attire: comfortable clothing that you can easily move in (e.g. tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, sweats, yoga pants). Circular dance skirts are sometimes used in this class to practice fundamental traditional Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian dance steps that are incorporated into choreographies. This class may be danced with supportive dance sneakers or barefoot. (No street shoes, please).

b7eef1bde1.title: Senior - Tap - Senior (IN PERSON) - Senior

notes:
In these classes you will experience the traditional rhythms, dances, and songs of Guinea. You will also learn the meaning of the different rhythms and their accompanying songs and dances. Some of the rhythms/ dances we will explore are used for weddings, baby-naming ceremonies, and circumcision rituals. The class begins with a warm-up, followed with across the floor choreography and concludes with an improvisational dance circle around the drummers.
Â
Class is danced barefoot.
c0fc8e9290.title: African Diaspora - West African Guinean (IN PERSON) - Mixed

notes:
Class begins with a simple, thorough barre emphasizing placement and alignment without the use of force. Following is center work designed to move dancers into spacious, expansive movement. Holistic and respectful, it is appropriate for people of all dance disciplines, both professional and novice alike.
Â
Students should wear ballet slippers and form-fitting dancewear. Leotard and tights are ideal, but students may adjust their attire so that they are comfortable.
c3aa57bf1c.title: Ballet - Ballet - Intermediate (IN PERSON) - Intermediate

notes: This class is geared towards students who have had some previous dance training, contemporary or non-contemporary. Norma Fong's classes incorporate Cunningham and Limon techniques and are aimed at providing an exciting environment for students to hone their technique and take their training to the next level. Personal attention from the instructor allow for the student to improve at their own pace and develop their individual dancing style. More difficult portions of combinations will be thoroughly explored in the warm-up, allowing for the student to understand the application of mechanics and technique to the movement.

notes:
Named San Francisco's Best Dance Workout by San Francisco Magazine (2015, 2016, & 2018) and Favorite and Unique Workout by 7x7 Magazine (2020).
Â
Rhythm & Motion dance workout classes are open to all students of all levels and abilities. Taught by experienced dancers and performing artists, the class features a broad range of movement styles with choreography inspired by popular music from around the globe. Balancing the challenge of learning choreography and movement techniques with the dance-floor euphoria of a good party, the (mostly) follow-along class format starts with a well-balanced warm-up and leads to high energy stamina and strength building choreography. The experience is low-pressure, joyful, full-bodied and sweaty. Everyone is welcome!
Fusion is our original fast-paced, follow-along format. Classes begin with a full-body warm-up that emphasizes dance technique, then builds to high energy dancing to increases stamina and strength. Class concludes with a floor combination to strengthen and stretch the abdomen, legs and arms.
Suggested attire: Comfortable clothing that you can easily move in (e.g. tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, yoga pants). Some people like to do this class in bare feet, but most people wear supportive footwear (no street shoes, please).
For more information, visit: rhythmandmotion.com
cb25a53749.title: Dance Workout - Rhythm & Motion: Fusion (IN PERSON) - Mixed

notes:
This new offering is intended to further develop the beginner dancer's confidence building on the Absolute Beginner Ballet workshop series and for beginner dancers who wish to improve their understanding of the fundamentals of ballet technique whilst further developing coordination, grace, spatial awareness, and musicality.
Â
Students will be led through a syllabus-style warm-up, gaining confidence in the progression of technique. Following the warm-up an in-depth coaching session will continue to explore rotating themes such as petit allegro (Small jumps), Adage (Slow graceful movements) Port de Bras (Arm work and coordination) Enchainement (Small dance sequences.), and Pirouette/Soutenu/Chainee (turning steps.) Allowing the beginner dancer to understand and absorb the work at a pace that allows for greater appreciation of the finer details in an enjoyable and nurturing environment.

Class focuses will run in 4-week sessions with drop-ins available.
Â
2023 Schedule
04/21, 04/28, 05/05, 05/12. " Enchainement"
06/02, 06/09, 06/16, 06/23 "Turns & turning steps"
06/30, 07/07, 07/14, 07/28. "Jumps". (No class 07/21)
08/04, 08/11, 08/18, 08/25. "Enchainement"
09/29, 10/06, 10/13, 10/20. "Turns and turning steps"
10/27, 11/03, 11/10, 11/17. "Jumps"
d7c272b6b6.title: Ballet - Beginner Ballet Refiner (IN PERSON) - Beginning

notes:
Engage your mind, body & spirit while learning the fundamentals of several Brazilian styles of dance & rhythms. Each dance style is broken down step by step. This class will focus on learning the basics of Samba in a fun and safe environment. Absolute beginners are welcome.
Â
Suggested attire: Comfortable clothing that you can easily move in (e.g. tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, sweats, yoga pants). Class is danced barefoot.

notes:
Named San Francisco's Best Dance Workout by San Francisco Magazine (2015, 2016, & 2018) and Favorite and Unique Workout by 7x7 Magazine (2020).


Rhythm & Motion dance workout classes are open to all students of all levels and abilities. Taught by experienced dancers and performing artists, the class features a broad range of movement styles with choreography inspired by popular music from around the globe. Balancing the challenge of learning choreography and movement techniques with the dance-floor euphoria of a good party, the (mostly) follow-along class format starts with a well-balanced warm-up and leads to high energy stamina and strength building choreography. The experience is low-pressure, joyful, full-bodied and sweaty. Everyone is welcome!
Our Modern format is rooted in contemporary and modern dance vocabulary. Students build core strength and technique through floor and barre-inspired choreography, and then move to standing choreography for technical skill and lyrical, full-body movement for stamina and strength.
Suggested attire: Comfortable clothing that you can easily move in (e.g. tank tops, t-shirts, shorts, yoga pants). This class is generally done in bare feet or socks.
For more information, visit rhythmandmotion.com

notes:
Essentrics is a dynamic and effective full body workout which simultaneously strengthens and stretches every muscle in the body resulting in greater joint mobility, improved posture and increased flexibility. Based on the theories of Miranda Esmonde-White this program draws on the methods of ballet and the healing principles of physiotherapy. Essentrics uses a broad spectrum of techniques and exercises to accomplish its many objectives by using smooth and restorative movements.

Please bring a mat or towel and dress comfortably.
Â
